question_sentence: In a first-of-its kind operation, a heart was transplanted from what animal to a human?
Georgia won the College Football National Championship after defeating Alabama, 33-18. This is its first title in the sport since:
Google claimed which tech service thrives because of bullying?
This year’s controversy-plagued Golden Globes took place behind closed doors. Which film won in the Best Movie - Drama category?
Chicago students returned to class this week after how many missed days of instruction?
Which one of these NFL teams did not fire its head coach this week?
Arby's has a new sandwich that's so spicy it comes with what?
Tampa Bay Buccaneers' quarterback Tom Brady refused to come out of the game until teammate Rob Gronkowski got a bonus of about how much?
What has been linked to lower death risks from Alzheimer's disease, per research published in the Journal of the American College of Cardiology?
Amid an ongoing sexual abuse lawsuit, Queen Elizabeth stripped who of their military associations and royal patronages?
What is the name of the Jeremy Corbyn-founded charity that the ex-Labour leader is reportedly considering upgrading to become a political party?
choices: For the Many, Not the Few
evidence: Corbyn is said to have privately accepted that his suspension as a Labour MP is unikely to be revoked, which would force him to stand as an independent in the next election.

question_sentence: The senior civil servant tasked with investigating Downing Street lockdown parties allegations, Sue Gray, previously pursued which alternate career?
evidence: Gray joined the civil service in the 1970s but took a break in the late 1980s to run a pub in rural County Down with her Northern Irish husband Bill Conlon, a country singer.

question_sentence: Ground-breaking ‘tearless’ onions are going on sale at which UK supermarket chain?
evidence: The tear-free onions were created by Rick Watson, a plant breeder, who used natural techniques to create a variety that do not cause cooks to cry when sliced.

question_sentence: The isolation period for people in England who test positive for Covid-19 is being cut from seven to how many days?
evidence: Health Secretary Sajid Javid said data from the UK Health Security Agency showed that ‘around two-thirds of positive cases are no longer infectious by the end of day five’.

question_sentence: Turkmenistan is planning to extinguish a huge gas crater fire known as the ‘Gateway to Hell’ that has burned for how long?
evidence: Experts have been ordered to put out the blaze in the 70-metre wide, 20-metre deep Darvaza crater, which is thought to have been burning since a Soviet drilling plan went awry in 1971.

question_sentence: What was described as ‘one of the last socially accepted forms of prejudice’ by the boss of the Equalities and Human Rights UK charity?
evidence: Human rights champion Chrissy Meleady said that prejudice against people with ginger hair was not just ‘harmless banter’ and that red-haired children need to be protected.

question_sentence: What common illness may give some protection against Covid-19, according to researchers at Imperial College London?
evidence: Researchers found that protective T-cells triggered by common cold coronaviruses could help fend off Covid-19 as they ‘remain in the body as a memory bank, ready to mount a defence against future attacks’, the BBC explained.

question_sentence: A 57-year-old man has become the first person in the world to undergo the successful transplant of a genetically modified heart from which animal?
evidence: David Bennett, who had terminal heart disease, underwent the nine-hour experimental procedure at the University of Maryland Medical Center in Baltimore. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: A new form of Covid test developed by an Israeli start-up takes how long to determine if users are infected with the virus?
evidence: The Virion Device detects the coronavirus using saliva samples and is designed for use in schools and airports.

question_sentence: Prince Andrew is expected to retain which military rank despite being stripped of most of his titles by the Queen?
choices: Vice Admiral of the Royal Navy
Colonel-in-chief of the Royal Lancers (Queen Elizabeth’s Own)
Royal Colonel of the Royal Highland Fusiliers
evidence: In a statement, Buckingham Palace said Prince Andrew ‘will continue not to undertake any public duties’ and will defend himself against sexual abuse allegations ‘as a private citizen’.

question_sentence: “We’ve got to vote like the future of our democracy depends on it.” Which influential figure made this plea in an open letter published in the New York Times?
evidence: Michelle Obama and her voting rights organization penned the letter, which was signed by 30 other civic engagement, voting rights and voter mobilization organizations.

question_sentence: Ousted civilian leader and Nobel prize winner Aung San Suu Kyi was sentenced to more time in prison in her home country, which has been scarred by violence following a military coup last year. What country is it?
evidence: Suu Kyi is standing trial in Myanmar, where she was ousted as the country’s de facto leader following a military coup in February of 2021.

question_sentence: This major awards show just took place, but you may not have known it since there was no televised ceremony, audience or red carpet due to Covid-19 concerns.
evidence: The presentation of the Golden Globes was held behind closed doors with results published online. In addition to Covid precautions, the event was also pared down because of diversity concerns within the Hollywood Foreign Press Association.

question_sentence: Tennis champion Novak Djokovic has been the subject of an intense visa controversy in which country, where he is scheduled to play an upcoming tournament?
evidence: Djokovic was detained in Australia following a visa cancelation due to his Covid-19 vaccination status. A judge ordered him to be released, and he is scheduled to play in next week’s Australian Open. However, questions about his status and documentation remain.

question_sentence: Comedian and actor Bob Saget passed away at the age of 65. In which 1990s sitcom did he famously star?
evidence: Saget, who in his later years became a standup comedy fixture, was most widely known for playing Danny Tanner, the father figure in the beloved sitcom “Full House.”

question_sentence: Which tech CEO earned a whopping $98.7 million in 2021?
evidence: Tim Cook, CEO of Apple, took home nearly $100 million last year. The sum included $82 million in stock awards, a $3 million base salary and $12 million in bonuses.

question_sentence: The Georgia Bulldogs won the 2022 National College Football Playoff Championship. Which team did they defeat to claim the title?
evidence: The Georgia Bulldogs defeated the No. 1 Alabama Crimson Tide marking the University of Georgia’s first football title since the 1980 season.

question_sentence: Which Black visionary is featured on a new US coin, the first in a series featuring prominent women in American history?
evidence: Select US quarters now feature Maya Angelou, all part of the American Women Quarters Program.

question_sentence: Which region of the world will likely see at least half of its population infected with the Omicron Covid-19 variant within the next two months, according to the WHO?
evidence: The World Health Organization predicts that Europe will likely see more than half its population infected in the next six to eight weeks.

question_sentence: Oreo is celebrating its 110th birthday on March 6. What brand new flavor will it release for the occasion?
evidence: Oreo is celebrating the occasion by releasing Chocolate Confetti Cake, an entirely new flavor that will run for a limited time starting January 31, according to the company.
